title: Overreliance
description: Overreliance occurs when users or systems trust LLM outputs too much without verification. This can lead to misinformation propagation, incorrect decisions based on LLM output, or blind trust in potentially inaccurate or biased LLM responses.
detection_patterns: Critical decisions based solely on LLM output
No human review of LLM responses
Automated systems trust LLM output completely
No confidence scoring or uncertainty indicators

mitigations.implementation: Implement fact-checking, cross-reference with trusted sources, and require human verification for critical outputs.

mitigations.description: Provide confidence scores and uncertainty indicators
mitigations.implementation: Display confidence levels, uncertainty indicators, and source citations to help users assess LLM output reliability.

mitigations.description: Require human review for critical outputs
mitigations.implementation: Mandate human review for high-stakes decisions, medical advice, legal information, or financial recommendations.
Clearly label AI-generated content, indicate limitations, and provide disclaimers about potential inaccuracies.
